attributes.comment:
In my opinion USCIS should not raise naturalization fees because it may discourage
people from becoming US citizens. Instead they should create a premium processing
for family unification forms such as I-130 or I-129F as to provide people with money to
process their cases faster or process them normally with a standard fees. The
premium processing should bring enough money to USCIS for required resources and
to reduce backlogs.

Permanent resident (Green Card Holders) generally pays federal & state taxes for up
to five years before they qualify for citizenship so they should not be penalized with
outragious fees when they decide to become a US citizen.

Premium processing have been in place for non-immigrant petitions and they are not
available for any immigrant petitions and that is why a citizen has to wait years to bring
their foreign spouses to USA. By introducing premium processing for 1-130 (spouse)
USCIS could get the extra money it needs while cutting I-130 backlogs.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
